input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row. See [usage docs](https://nf-co.re/ausargph/usage#samplesheet-input).

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

general_options.title: Filter genome, Blat Database and general options
general_options.description: Reference genome and and Blat Database related files and options required for the workflow.

stage.description: The stage to start the workflow from ('from-start' or 'from-prg'). By default the workflow runs 'from-start' meaning it looks for a sample info file with paths to raw reads. If '--stage from-prg' is specified the workflow looks for a modified sample info file with paths to PRG files.

filter.description: Path to the filter sequences FASTA file.
filter.help_text: The filtering sequences file is just another FASTA file of your focal loci, but from phylogenetically near samples (high similarity, e.g. intra-family). This is optional, but may be useful for speeding up the assembly step. These sequences are used as a reference to quickly (and loosely) map the raw reads against to exclude off-target sequences that would otherwise slow down the assembly. Locus names do not have to be unique and redundant targets from different taxa may improve filtration.

blat_db.description: Path to the target sequences FASTA file.
blat_db.help_text: The target sequence file is simply a FASTA file of your focal loci. Locus names must be unique, and ideally the target sequence data is not too divergent from your samples (though BLAT is quite flexible). An example targets file is included in bin/SqCL_Targets.fasta, and is appropriate for use with SqCL projects.

tree_method.help_text: Choose the preferred tree estimation method for individual locus trees. All methods should provide qualitatively identical results. Suggested Usage: iqtree

assembly.description: The assembly to be used in the analysis.
assembly.help_text: Supported options are: 'trinity' or 'SPAdes'. Suggested Usage: trinity

trim_alignment.help_text: if true, use GBLOCKS to trim initial MAFFT alignments. May proceed slowly. If false, proceed to phylogenetic estimation using initial MAFFT alignments

disable_adapter_trimming.description: Disable trimming adapter in the input reads.

batching_size.description: Number of alignment files to be processed sequentially in batches to avoide submitting large number of jobs when using HPCs.
batching_size.help_text: Number of sample files that constitute a batch. Controls the number of output files generated which is sometimes limited on HPCs (1 million), see [here](https://groups.google.com/g/trinityrnaseq-users/c/w9S8UwL8uiU/m/KzdBydHp7RsJ). This helps to avoid generating large number of files as well as to reduce the number of the submitted jobs to an HPC.

trinity_scratch_tmp.description: Trinity generates large number of intermediate files which can be an issue for some HPCs that limits the file number for each user. This option will make trinity writes to `/tmp` directory on the compute node then copy the compressed output directory (not the fasta) to the workdirectory to avoid this issue.

no_tree_merge.description: Do not merge all trees at the end.

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

version.description: Display the version of the pipeline.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

tracedir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

show_hidden_params.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.

enable_conda.description: Run this workflow with Conda. You can also use '-profile conda' instead of providing this parameter.

singularity_cache_dir.description: The path to store singularity containers locally to be reused later

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

saved_output_options.title: Pipeline output options
saved_output_options.description: Decide on what processes output to keep.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

phylogeny_make_alignments_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'phylogeny_make_alignments' will be saved in the output directory.
phylogeny_make_alignments_keep_output.help_text: process output is a collection of raw alignments, where each file represents a single locus and contains unaligned sequence data for all recovered samples

assembly_postprocessing_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'assembly_postprocessing' will be saved in the output directory.
assembly_postprocessing_keep_output.help_text: process output for each sample is a single fasta file containing all assembled contigs, as well as a directory with all Trinity output files (inchworm, jellyfish, read normalization files). Each sample directory can be very large (>3G), so we do not recommend retaining these files.

trimmomatic_clean_pe_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'trimmomatic_clean_pe' will be saved in the output directory.
trimmomatic_clean_pe_keep_output.help_text: process output for each sample are forward and reverse, paired and unpaired fq.gz files (4 total). These are the result of leading/trailing read trimming.

trimmomatic_clean_se_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'trimmomatic_clean_se' will be saved in the output directory.
trimmomatic_clean_se_keep_output.help_text: process output for each sample is a single unpaired fq.gz file. This is the result of leading/trailing read trimming.

parse_blat_results_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'parse_blat_results' will be saved in the output directory.

quality_2_assembly_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'quality_2_assembly' will be saved in the output directory.
quality_2_assembly_keep_output.help_text: process output for each sample is a csv file summarizing the target coverage (number of contigs, AHE, UCE, gene tallies)

samplesheet_check_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'samplesheet_check' will be saved in the output directory.

bbmap_reformat_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'bbmap_reformat' will be saved in the output directory.

prepare_adaptor_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'prepare_adaptor' will be saved in the output directory.

convert_phyml_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'convert_phyml' will be saved in the output directory.

preprocessing_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'preprocessing' will be saved in the output directory.

bbmap_dedupe_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'bbmap_dedupe' will be saved in the output directory.
bbmap_dedupe_keep_output.help_text: process output for each sample are a fq.gz file of deduplicated reads, and another fq.gz file of duplicates

bbmap_filter_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'bbmap_filter' will be saved in the output directory.
bbmap_filter_keep_output.help_text: process output for each sample are forward and reverse reads that have been filtered against a set of phylogenetically informed targets

perl_cleanup_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'perl_cleanup' will be saved in the output directory.

concatenate_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'concatenate' will be saved in the output directory.

merge_trees_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'merge_trees' will be saved in the output directory.

trimmomatic_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'trimmomatic' will be saved in the output directory.

make_prg_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'make_prg' will be saved in the output directory.
make_prg_keep_output.help_text: process output for each sample is a single Pseudo-Reference-Genome fasta file holding the successfully assembled and annotated targets. These are worthile to retain.

gblocks_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'gblocks' will be saved in the output directory.

testing_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'testing' will be saved in the output directory.

trinity_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'trinity' will be saved in the output directory.

iqtree_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'iqtree' will be saved in the output directory.

aster_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'aster' will be saved in the output directory.

macse_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'macse' will be saved in the output directory.

mafft_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'mafft' will be saved in the output directory.

raxml_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'raxml' will be saved in the output directory.

blat_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'blat' will be saved in the output directory.

pear_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'pear' will be saved in the output directory.

sed_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'sed' will be saved in the output directory.

spades_keep_output.description: If enabled, the output of process 'SPAdes' will be saved in the output directory.

trimmomatic_options.title: trimmomatic options
trimmomatic_options.description: The configurations of the process trimmomatic.

trimmomatic_clean_minlength.description: Minimum read length to be retained after trimming
trimmomatic_clean_minlength.help_text: Discard reads shorter than this minimum threshold after adaptor/barcode trimming. Suggested Usage: 36

trimmomatic_clean_trail.description: Remove trailing bases below indicated quality
trimmomatic_clean_trail.help_text: Discard trailing bases below this minimum quality threshold. Suggested Usage: 3

trimmomatic_clean_head.description: Remove leading bases below indicated quality
trimmomatic_clean_head.help_text: Discard leading bases below this minimum quality threshold.  Suggested Usage: 3

trimmomatic_clean_qual.description: Minimum quality score of 4-base sliding window
trimmomatic_clean_qual.help_text: Cut the read when the 4-base sliding window quality score drops below this threshold.  Suggested Usage: 15

trimmomatic_args.description: The arguments to be passed to process (trimmomatic).

trimmomatic_cpus.description: The number of requested CPUs for the process (trimmomatic).

trimmomatic_memory.description: The requested memory for the process (trimmomatic).

trimmomatic_walltime.description: The requested walltime for the process (trimmomatic).

make_prg_options.title: make_prg options
make_prg_options.description: The configurations of the process make_prg.

make_prg_args.description: The arguments to be passed to process (make_prg).

make_prg_cpus.description: The number of requested CPUs for the process (make_prg).

make_prg_memory.description: The requested memory for the process (make_prg).

make_prg_walltime.description: The requested walltime for the process (make_prg).

gblocks_options.title: gblocks options
gblocks_options.description: The configurations of the process gblocks.

gblocks_b1.description: Minimum number of sequences to be identified as a conserved site
gblocks_b1.help_text: This establishes the minimum threshold for identifying a conserved site. The value must be greater than half the number of sequences, e.g. min value is 0.5 and we'll round that up

gblocks_b2.description: Minimum number of sequences to be identified as a flanking site
gblocks_b2.help_text: Flanking sites are assessed until they make a series of conserved positions at both flanks relative to the contiguous nonconserved sites. This value must be equal to or greater than the value of b1

gblocks_args.description: The arguments to be passed to process (gblocks).

gblocks_cpus.description: The number of requested CPUs for the process (gblocks).

gblocks_memory.description: The requested memory for the process (gblocks).

gblocks_walltime.description: The requested walltime for the process (gblocks).

testing_options.title: testing options
testing_options.description: The configurations of the process testing.

testing_cpus.description: The number of requested CPUs for the process (testing).

testing_memory.description: The requested memory for the process (testing).

testing_walltime.description: The requested walltime for the process (testing).

trinity_options.title: trinity options
trinity_options.description: The configurations of the process trinity.

trinity_normalize_reads.description: Normalize the read pool, discarding excess coverage
trinity_normalize_reads.help_text: Depending on the sequencing effort, there may be excess reads (above desired coverage) that will slow down computation by requiring additional memory. New versions of trinity normalize reads do this by default, and it's highly recommended here.

trinity_args.description: The arguments to be passed to process (trinity).

trinity_cpus.description: The number of requested CPUs for the process (trinity).

trinity_memory.description: The requested memory for the process (trinity).

trinity_walltime.description: The requested walltime for the process (trinity).

blat_options.title: blat options
blat_options.description: The configurations of the process blat.
blat_options.help_text: See the [blat User Guide](https://genome.ucsc.edu/goldenpath/help/blatSpec.html) for more information

blat_parser_match.description: Minimum required percent (0-100) match between contig and target
blat_parser_match.help_text: Discards contig-to-target matches below minimum threshold provided. Values closer to 100 require greater similarity. Suggested Usage: 80

blat_parser_evalue.description: Minimum required e-value for match between contig and target
blat_parser_evalue.help_text: Discards contig-to-target matches greater than threshold provided. Values closer to 0 (smaller) require greater similarity. Suggested Usage: 1e-10

blat_args.description: The arguments to be passed to process (blat).

blat_cpus.description: The number of requested CPUs for the process (blat).

blat_memory.description: The requested memory for the process (blat).

blat_walltime.description: The requested walltime for the process (blat).

pear_cpus.description: The number of requested CPUs for the process (pear).

pear_walltime.description: The requested walltime for the process (pear).
